templeHistory.title: History of the Temple
templeHistory.paragraph1: Hanuman is the very embodiment of Bhakti, “The Bhakta of Bhaktas”. His adoration of the incarnate divinity of Rama is absolute. A very popular god among both rural and urban devotees, he is worshiped for various benefits: health, wealth, happiness, fulfillment of desires, success, and magical accomplishments.
templeHistory.paragraph2: The history behind the name of the temple is as fascinating as Hanuman's Leelas. It is believed that a big heap of Ragi (a food grain) turned into stone, hence the name “Ragigudda”. The temple was constructed in 1969 and has since evolved into a grand complex.
